description.narrative: IR 3. Increased support to programmes to scale up essential family heathcare practices, education and child protection issues in target areas by 2012, which contributes to Child Health, Corporate External Relations And Partnerships, Communication And Resource Mobilization, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Immunization, Learning Outcomes, Sanitation. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved policy analysis, capacity of stakeholders for engendered progra mme planning, monitoring and Evaluation strengthened structures for soc ial change, contribute to the achievement of results for children

sector.narrative: Advocacy and partnership-building for social behaviour change
Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
Provision of parental education for school readiness (including in temporary learning spaces)
Technical assistance - Cross-sectoral communication for development

title.narrative: Sierra Leone United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Policy on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF procedure for programme implementation partnerships
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Sierra Leone 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

related-activity.ref: 3900/A0/05/004 IMPROVED KNOWLEDGE AND CAPACITY OF STAKE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 3. Increased support to programmes to scale up essential family heathcare practices, education and child protection issues in target areas by 2012
